intro: Cassine peragua subsp. affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cassine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Cassine peragua subsp. affinis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
